note.p: This Christmas card contains a brief message from Laurence Browne to his sisters Mary and Nellie. The card was written on board the H.M.S. Defence and Lawrence writes that he was on his way to Malta or the Dardanelles.

Lawrence was a gunner in the Royal Marine Artillery. On 31 May 1916 the HMS Defence was sunk during the Battle of Jutland, the largest naval battle of the Great War, and Lawrence was killed. His body was never recovered.

div.p:
Fondest memories ever cling
Through all the changes
time may bring

ab.seg:
Christmas, 1915 "Times change and circumstances alter, but the
kindly thoughts and pleasant memories that are
associated with Christmas grow deeper year by
year."
With Kind Regards
and
Best Wishes for Christmas
and the coming Year.
From

div.closer:
Lawrence To his dear little sisters Mary and Nellie
with love. Will write later
on as we are on our way
to malta or the dardnells good By XXXXXXX
H. M. S. "Defence"
